01

03

North
Umpqua Trail,
Oregon

Along the North Umpqua Trail, Native Americans once fished for salmon and gathered Oregon Grape, a powerful medicinal plant that is now the state’s official flower.

The Umpqua is a river whose Native American name translates as “thundering waters.”

The Umpqua Trail has 12 different routes that range from moderate climbs to monumental treks.

The Joshua Tree

The Umpqua is a river whose Native American name translates as “thundering waters.”

The Umpqua Trail has 12 different routes that range from moderate climbs to monumental treks.

Along the North Umpqua Trail, Native Americans once fished for salmon and gathered Oregon Grape, a powerful medicinal plant that is now the state’s official flower.

The Florida Keys

Along the North Umpqua Trail, Native Americans once fished for salmon and gathered Oregon Grape, a powerful medicinal plant that is now the state’s official flower.

The county consists of a section on the mainland which is almost entirely in Everglades National Park.

The Umpqua Trail has 12 different routes that range from moderate climbs to monumental treks.
